steps.title: Click on the Firefox drop-down menu at the top left of the browser and select Add-ons.
steps.content: Click on the Firefox drop-down menu at the top left of the browser and select Add-ons .

steps.title: Type Greasemonkey into the add-ons search box at the top right of the browser.
steps.content: Type Greasemonkey into the add-ons search box at the top right of the browser.

steps.title: Find Greasemonkey in the list and click on Install.
steps.content: Find Greasemonkey in the list and click on Install .

steps.title: Find a Greasemonkey script that you want to install.
steps.content: Find a Greasemonkey script that you want to install. Visit www.userscripts.org, a web repository that contains thousands of custom scripts that can be used with Greasemonkey.

steps.title: Use the User Scripts search box to find specific scripts that you want to use.
steps.content: Use the User Scripts search box to find specific scripts that you want to use. For example, if you would like to find ways to improve your Facebook browsing experience, type "Facebook" into the search box to see a list of all Greasemonkey scripts that affect Facebook.

steps.title: Click on Scripts in the website navigation bar if you just want to browse all of the available scripts.
steps.content: Click on Scripts in the website navigation bar if you just want to browse all of the available scripts. This is good if you don't have a specific script in mind and just want to see what's out there.

steps.title: Click on Tags in the website navigation bar if you want to view scripts by categories.
steps.content: Click on Tags in the website navigation bar if you want to view scripts by categories. The tags in the list will be different sizes based on their popularity: the larger the text, the more popular the category. This is a good way to see what's popular right now.

steps.title: Click on Install once you've found a script that you want to install.
steps.content: Click on Install once you've found a script that you want to install.
